newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenia's Salus says 96 net down 7.0 pct.
newsitem.headline: Slovenia's Salus says 96 net down 7.0 pct.

text.p: Slovenian drug wholesaler Salus said on Friday its 1996 net profit fell to 457.5 million tolars ($2.9 million) from 491.9 million in a year earlier and said it expected a similar profit in the current year.
The company declined to detail the reasons for the decline in earnings but said the 1995 profit figure had been "exceptionally high".
Salus plans to pay an unchanged dividend of 1,500 tolars per share this year.
Chief executive Igor Jenko told Reuters group turnover rose to 10.34 billion tolars from 9.25 billion a year ago and said the group expected a slight increase in this year's turnover.

"Our investments in 1996 were 150 million tolars and were spent on modernising our technology. This year we plan to increase investment to some 500 million tolars in order to build new facilities and to modernise the exisiting ones," he added.

Salus's market share in 1996 was about 27 percent, unchanged from the previous year but the firm said it planned to increase it slightly this year. -- Novica Mihajlovic, Ljubljana newsroom, 386-61-125-8439
